items.content_html: I think I need to re-watch ‚ÄúThe Good Place‚Äù. (It‚Äôs available on Netflix.) And, hey, there‚Äôs a behind-the-scenes podcast for the show, too!
I will be pretty upset when Apple ditches the charging port someday. My favorite headphones depend on it.
New Hampshire
Google is discontinuing its Inbox Email App. Oh. Google is discontinuing another product. It must be a Monday, Tuesday, Wednesday, Thursday, Friday, Saturday, or Sunday.

Sigh. No stainless steel Apple Watch for me (probably).

MacStories has a good overview of the Apple Watch Series 4. For me, because I planned to upgrade this year, the most important bit of information (which Apple glossed over in their presentation yesterday) is the price:

If you like stainless steel Apple Watch models, I‚Äôm sorry. The steel variants are only available with cellular capabilities, which is a $100 price increase from aluminum models. As such, stainless steel Series 4 models have a starting price of $699. Steel models also still cost the old $50 to upgrade size to 44mm, so the starting point for the larger steel Series 4 is $749. All of these baseline prices only get you a sport band, so you‚Äôll be shelling out even more if you want to pick up a nicer watch band as well. (At least your old bands still fit though!)

I really wanted a stainless steel Apple Watch, mainly because it looks so much better, in my opinion, than the anodized aluminum ones. But $749 is too expensive for me to buy a watch that I will probably want to replace in only 3 years. On top of that, I don‚Äôt think I need the cellular connectivity, either.

I am happy about all the Apple announcements today. I may not buy any of the new hardware‚Äîthough the new Apple Watch is kind of tempting‚Äîbut I certainly admire all the cool technology they are bringing to market.
I have unsubscribed from so many podcasts that I have run out of things to listen to. Hopefully there will be some Apple event hot takes coming in tomorrow.
It‚Äôs time to find out what we already know about the new Apple Watch and next-gen iPhone X.
Community art, from a street fair in Bethlehem, New Hampshire
New Hampshire
I actually have to buy new silverware for our big dinner tomorrow.
New Hampshire

I am sad that Exponent, one of my favorite podcasts, has entered an indefinite, and maybe permanent, hiatus. Ben Thompson and James Allsworth had great insights into technology and business. Listening to them made me feel like I was in business school again, but with two of the smartest professors (or maybe classmates) in the room.

I found out that Toad the Wet Sproket re-recorded their greatest hits from the 1990s. All You Want was released in 2011. It‚Äôs unusual for a band to re-record songs in the studio (live albums are another thing entirely). I found it enjoyable to listen to, though I‚Äôm not sure why they did it. The production is more modern‚Äîread, a lot louder, but with a larger soundstage‚Äîbut the songs aren‚Äôt re-interpreted or anything.

Texas did this, too, with Texas 25, which marked their 25th anniversary as a band. Texas reinterpreted some of their songs, though. That album sounds great and is worth a listen.
üéµ Today‚Äôs listen: Fine Young Cannibals‚Äô The Raw and the Cooked on my V-Moda Crossfade 2 üéß.

My late-evening de-stressing video game sessions have moved from Transistor, which I played through twice, to Oceanhorn. Oceanhorn plays like a Zelda clone. I‚Äôm finding it to be fun, and it has MFi controller support, which makes it much easier for me to play.
I don‚Äôt remember hopscotch being drawn this way, but I‚Äôm glad my driveway has WiFi.
I‚Äôm thinking of writing an iOS app that will simply pick a random album from your Apple Music ‚ÄúLibrary‚Äù and queue it up for playback in the Music app.
I tried to up my lunch game today. Note: I did not eat the entire ribeye!
üéµ I don‚Äôt always listen to ‚ÄúJosie and the Pussycats‚Äù but when I do, it‚Äôs Kay Hanley singing.
Drinking oolong tea is good, but I need to get a Red Sox mug.
A sunflower in the backyard. My daughter loves these, but we don‚Äôt admire them often enough.
Bretton Woods, New Hampshire
As of right now I have upgraded all of my iOS devices to the iOS 12 beta. I‚Äôm happy to report that the apps that I write are working just fine. In fact, everything is working fine.
